info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN SHELBY, WESTERN CHAMPAIGN, SOUTHWESTERN LOGAN, DARKE, NORTHWESTERN CLARK AND MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Anna to Arcanum, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Troy, Sidney, Piqua, Bellefontaine, Greenville, Tipp City, West Milton, Versailles, Covington, Arcanum, St. Paris, Newport, Bradford, West Liberty, Fort Loramie, De Graff, Pleasant Hill, Ansonia, New Madison and Brown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
